meanings.definition: A place of residence or home.
meanings.sent1: Their domicile was a cozy little house on the corner.
meanings.sent2: She returned to her domicile after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made its domicile in the hollow tree, much to the annoyance of the birds.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion stood as a grand domicile of memories from a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The domicile of the ant colony was a complex network of tunnels underground.

meanings.sent1: They planned to domicile in the new city for the next few years.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to domicile in the countryside for a peaceful life.
meanings.sent3: The idea of domiciling in a treehouse seemed adventurous but impractical.
meanings.sent4: She domiciled her trust in the wrong person and regretted it later.
meanings.sent5: The nomadic tribe would domicile in different locations depending on the season.
